title: The Believer the Object of Divine Love
devotional:
In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because 
that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him. I John 4:9.
poem:
Pause, my soul, adore and wonder,
Ask, Oh, why such love to me?
Grace hath put me in the number
Of the Saviour's family:Hallelujah!
Thanks, eternal thanks to thee.

title: Redeemed by the Blood of Christ
devotional: Forasmuch as ye know that ye were not redeemed with corruptible things, as silver and gold,—But with the precious blood of Christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot. I Peter 1:18, 19

title: Renewed by the Holy Ghost
devotional: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost. Titus 3:5
poem:
Vain is every outward rite,
Unless thy grace be given:Nothing but thy life and light,
Can form a soul for heaven.

title: Partaker of the Divine Nature
devotional: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust. 2 Peter 1:4

title: Justified Before God Through Christ
devotional: By him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses. Acts 13:39
poem:
Jesus, thy blood and righteousness
My beauty are, and glorious dress;'Midst flaming worlds, in these array'd,
With joy shall I lift up my head.

title: United to Christ
devotional: I am the vine, ye are the branches: he that abideth in me, and I in him, he same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing. John 15:5
poem:
Lord of the vineyard, we adore
That power and grace divine,
Which plants our wild, our barren souls,
In Christ the living Vine.

title: Joint-Heir with Christ
devotional: If children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ. Romans 8:17

title: Complete in Christ
devotional:
For in him dwelleth all the fulness of the Godhead bodily. And ye are 
complete in him. Col. 2:9, 10
poem:
Thy saints on earth, and those above,
Here join in sweet accord:One body all in mutual love,
And thou their common Lord.
Yes, thou that body wilt present
Before thy Father's face,
Nor shall a wrinkle or a spot
Its beauteous form disgrace.

title: Christ the Believer's Advocate
devotional: If any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. 1 John 2:1
poem:
Look up, my soul, with cheerful eye,
See where the great Redeemer stands—
Thy glorious Advocate on high,
With precious incense in his hands.

title: Christ the Hope of the Believer
devotional: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God our Saviour, and Lord Jesus Christ, which is our hope. 1 Tim. 1:1
poem:
Jesus, my Lord, I look to thee;
Where else can helpless sinners go?
Thy boundless love shall set me free
From all my wretchedness and woe.

title: Christ the Life of the Believer
devotional: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with him in glory. Col. 3:4
poem:
If my immortal Saviour lives,
Then my eternal life is sure;
His word a firm foundation gives,
Here let me build, and rest secure.

title: Christ the Peace of the Believer
devotional: Now in Christ Jesus ye who sometime were far off are made nigh by the blood of Christ. For he is our peace. Eph. 2:13, 14
poem:
"He is our peace"—for by his blood
Sinners are reconcil'd to God;
Sweet harmony is now restor'd,
And man beloved, and God ador'd.

title: Christ the Righteousness of the Believer
devotional: This is his name whereby he shall be called, The Lord our righteousness. Jer. 23:6
poem:
Saviour divine, we know thy name,
And in that name we trust;
Thou art the Lord our righteousness,
Thou art thine Israel's boast.

title: The Temple of the Spirit
devotional: Know ye not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you, which ye have of God. 1 Cor. 6:19
poem:
Creator Spirit! by whose aid
The world's foundations first were laid,
Come, visit every humble mind;
Come, pour thy joys on human kind:From sin and sorrow set us free,
And make us temples worthy thee.

title: Sanctified by the Spirit
devotional: God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth. 2 Thess. 2:13
poem:
Come, Holy Spirit, love divine,
Thy cleansing power impart;
Each erring thought and wish refine
That wanders near my heart.

title: Upheld by the Spirit
devotional: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man. Eph. 3:16
poem:
Assisted by his grace,
We still pursue our way;
And hope at last to reach the prize,
Secure in endless day.

title: The Spirit of Adoption Received
devotional: Ye have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but ye have received the Spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba Father. Rom. 8:15
poem:
Assure my conscience of her part
In the Redeemer's blood,
And bear thy witness in my heart
That I am born of God.

title: Comforted by the Spirit
devotional: When the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me. John 25:26
poem:
In the hour of my distress,
When temptations me oppress,
And when I my sins confess—
Sweet Spirit, comfort me.

title: Sealed by the Spirit
devotional: Grieve not the holy Spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption. Eph. 4:30
poem:
Forbid it, Lord, that we
Who from thy hands receive
The Spirit's power to make us free,
Should e'er that Spirit grieve.

title: Taught by the Spirit
devotional: When he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will show you things to come. John 16:13
poem:
Thine inward teachings make me know
The mysteries of redeeming love,
The emptiness of things below,
And excellence of things above.

title: Fellow-Citizen with the Saints
devotional: Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellow-citizens with the saints, and the household of God. Eph. 2:19
poem:
The kindred links of life are bright,
Yet not so bright as those
In which Christ's favoured friends unite,
And each on each repose:Where all the hearts in union cling,
With Him, the centre and the spring.

title: Lives a Life of Faith in Christ
devotional: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God. Gal. 2:20
poem:
Close to the ignominious tree,
Jesus, my humbled soul would cleave;
Despised and crucified with thee,
With Christ resolved to die and live:There would I bow my suppliant knee,
And own no other Lord but thee.

title: Lives a Life of Consecration to God
devotional: I beseech you therefore, brethren, but the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service. Rom. 12:1

title: Lives a Life of Hope
devotional: Looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life. Jude 21

title: Delivered from Condemnation
devotional: There is now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit. Rom. 8:1
poem:
O Love, thou bottomless abyss!
My sins are swallow'd up in thee;
Cover'd is my unrighteousness,
While Jesus' blood through earth and skies,"Mercy, free boundless mercy!" cries.

title: Delivered from the Power of Satan
devotional: Forasmuch then as the children are partakers of flesh and blood, he also himself likewise took part of the same; that through death he might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil. Heb. 2:14
poem:
Dry up your tears, ye saints, and tell
How high your great Deliverer reigns;
Sing, how he spoiled the host of hell,
And led the tyrant Death in chains.

title: Delivered from All Iniquity
devotional: Let Israel hope in the Lord: for with the Lord there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption. And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities. Psalm 130:7, 8
poem:
Fix'd on this ground will I remain,
Though my heart fail, and flesh decay;
This anchor shall my soul sustain,
When earth's foundations melt away:Mercy's full power I then shall prove,
Lov'd with an everlasting love.

title: Delivered from All Enemies
devotional: He delivereth me from mine enemies; yea, thou liftest me above those that rise up against me. Psalm 18:48
poem:
Foes are round us, but we stand
On the borders of our land:Jesus, God's exalted Son,
Bids us undismay'd go on:Onward then we gladly press
Through this earthly wilderness.

title: Enjoys a Present Salvation
devotional: Which in time past were not a people, but are now the people of God: which had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy. 1 Pet. 2:10
poem:
Fill'd with holy emulation
Let us vie with those above:Sweet the theme—a free salvation,
Fruit of everlasting love.

title: Preserved unto Eternal Salvation
devotional: Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time. 1 Pet. 1:5
poem:
Saints by the power of God are kept
Till full salvation come;
We walk by faith as strangers here
Till Christ shall call us home.

title: A Pilgrim to a Heavenly Country
devotional: Now they desire a better country, that is an heavenly: wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God: for he hat prepared for them a city. Heb. 11:16
poem:
'Tis true, we are but strangers
And sojourners below;
And countless snares and dangers
Surround the path we go:Though painful and distressing,
Yet there's a rest above,
And onward we are pressing
To reach that land of love.

title: Supreme Love to God
devotional: "Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life? —- And he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind." Luke 10:25, 27
poem:
Yes, I would love thee, blessed God!
Paternal goodness marks thy name;
Thy praises, through thy high abode,
The heavenly hosts with joy proclaim.

title: Gratitude to God
devotional: And one of them, [the ten lepers,] when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God. Luke 17:15
poem:
What thanks I owe thee, and what love,
A boundless, endless store,
Shall echo through the realms above,
When time shall be no more.

title: Obedience to God
devotional:
Ye were the servants of sin, but ye have obeyed from the heart that 
form of doctrine which was delivered you. Being then made free from sin, ye became the 
servants of righteousness. Rom. 6:17, 18
poem:
Love is the fountain whence
All true obedience flows;
The Christian serves the God he loves,
And loves the God he knows.

title: Submission to God
devotional: We have had fathers of our flesh which corrected us, and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection unto the Father of spirits, and live? Heb. 12:9
poem:
Oh let my trembling soul be still,
While darkness veils this mortal eye,
And wait thy wise, thy holy will
Wrapp'd yet in tears and mystery:I cannot, Lord, thy purpose see,
Yet all is well—since ruled by thee.

title: Faith in Christ
devotional: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God. 1 John 5:1

title: Love to Christ
devotional: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me. Matt. 10:37
poem:
Whom have I on earth below?
Thee, and only thee, I know:Whom have I in heaven but thee?
Thou art all in all to me.

title: Self-Denial for Christ
devotional: If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross daily, and follow me. Luke 9:23
poem:
Take up thy cross, let not its weight
Fill thy weak spirit with alarm,
My strength shall bear thy spirit up,
And brace thy heart, and nerve thy arm.

title: Confession of Christ
devotional: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God. 1 John 4:15
poem:
I'll tell to all poor sinners round,
How great a Saviour I have found;
I'll point to his redeeming blood,
And say, "Behold the way to God."

title: Devotedness to Christ
devotional: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's. Rom. 14:8
poem:
My soul, and all its powers,
Thine, wholly thine, shall be;
All, all my happy hours
I consecrate to thee:Whate'er I have, whate'er I am,
Shall magnify my Saviour's name.

title: Imitation of Christ
devotional: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you. John 13:15
poem:
Thy fair example may I trace,
To teach me what I ought to be:Make me, by thy transforming grace,
My Saviour, daily more like thee.

title: Christ is Precious
devotional: Behold, I lay in Sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on him shall not be confounded. Unto you therefore which believe he is precious. 1 Pet. 2:6, 7
poem:
Jesus, in thy transporting name
What glories meet our eyes!
Thou art the angels' sweetest theme,
The wonder of the skies.

title: Possession of the Spirit of Christ
devotional: Ye are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man have not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his. Rom. 8:9

title: Led by the Spirit
devotional: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, they are the sons of God. Rom. 8:14
poem:
Lead us to holiness—the road
That we must take to dwell with God:Lead us to Christ—the living way,
Nor let us from his pastures stray:Lead us to God—our final rest,
In his enjoyment to be blest:Lead us to heaven—the seat of bliss,
Where pleasure in perfection is.

title: Conviction of Sin
devotional: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin. For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me. Psalm 38:3, 4
poem:
O Thou that hear'st the prayer of faith,
Wilt thou not save my soul from death,
My soul that rests on thee?
I have no refuge of my own,
But fly to what my Lord hath done
And suffer'd once for me.

title: Repentance for Sin
devotional: Godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death. 2 Cor. 7:10
poem:
My lips with shame my sins confess
Against thy law, against thy grace:Lo, should thy judgments grow severe,
I am condemn'd, but thou art clear.

title: Hatred to Sin
devotional: Whosoever is born of God doth not commit sin; for his seed remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, because he is born of God. 1 John 3:9
poem:
Oh! give, Lord, the tender heart
That trembles at the approach of sin,
A godly fear of sin impart,
Implant and root it deep within.

title: Self-Righteousness Renounced
devotional: Yea doubtless, and I count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but dung, that I may win Christ. Phil. 3:8
poem:
On thee alone my hope relies;
Beneath the cross I fall,
My Lord, my life, my sacrifice,
My Saviour, and my all.

title: The World Overcome by Faith
devotional: Whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith. 1 John 5:4
poem:
'Tis faith that conquers earth and hell
By a celestial power;
This is the grace that shall prevail
In the decisive hour.

title: Non-Conformity to the World
devotional: Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world. If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him. 1 John 2:15
poem:
Why should our poor enjoyments here
Be thought so pleasant and so dear,
And tempt our hearts astray?
Our brightest joys are fading fast,
The longest life will soon be past;
And if we go to heaven at last,
We need not wish to stay.

title: Spiritual-Mindedness
devotional: They that are after the flesh do mind the things of the flesh; but they that are after the Spirit the things of the Spirit. Rom. 8:5
poem:
Let worldly minds the world pursue,
It has no charms for me;
Once I admired its trifles too,
But grace has set me free.

title: Heavenly-Mindedness
devotional: Our conversation is in heaven; from whence also we look for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ. Phil. 3:20
poem:
Beyond the bounds of time and space
Look forward to that heavenly place,
The saints' secure abode;
On faith's strong eagle pinion rise,
And force your passage to the skies,
Strong in the strength of God.

title: Constrained by Love
devotional: The love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead: and that he died for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him which died for them, and rose again. 2 Cor. 5:14, 15
poem:
Be all my heart, be all my days,
Devoted to thy single praise;
And let my glad obedience prove
How much I owe, how much I love.

title: Love of the Truth
devotional: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error. 1 John 4:6
poem:
Order my footsteps by thy word,
And make my heart sincere;
Let sin have no dominion, Lord,
But keep my conscience clear.

title: Perseverance in the Truth
devotional: They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us. 1 John 2:19
poem:
When any turn from Zion's way,(Alas, what numbers do!)Methinks I hear my Saviour say,
Wilt thou forsake me too?

title: Love to the Scriptures
devotional: I love thy commandments above gold; yea, above fine gold. Thy testimonies are wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them. Ps. 119:127, 129
poem:
Here mines of knowledge, love, and joy,
Are open'd to our sight,
The purest gold without alloy,
And gems divinely bright.

title: Love to Enemies
devotional: Love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil. Luke 6:3
poem:
Lord, shall thy bright example shine
In vain before my eyes?
Give me a soul akin to thine,
To love my enemies.

title: Love to the Brethren
devotional:
Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that 
loveth is born of God, and knoweth God. 1 John 4:7
poem:
Bless'd be the tie that binds
Our hearts in Christian love;
The fellowship of kindred minds
Is like to that above.

title: The Witness of Conscience
devotional: Hereby we know that we are of the truth, and shall assure our hearts before him. Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God. 1 John 3:19, 21
poem:
How happy are the new-born race,
Partakers of adopting grace!
How pure the bliss they share!
Hid from the world and all its eyes,
Within their hearts the blessing lies,
And conscience feels it there.

title: God the Believer's Sun and Shield
devotional: The Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory; no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly. Ps. 84:11
poem:
If thou art my shield and my sun,
The night is no darkness to me;
And fast as my moments roll on,
They bring me but nearer to thee.

title: God the Glory of the Believer
devotional: Thou, Lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head. Ps. 3:3
poem:
Lord, let thy grace surround me still,
And like a bulwark prove,
To guard my soul from every ill,
Secured by sovereign love.

title: All Blessings Through Christ
devotional: All things are yours' whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours; and ye are Christ's; and Christ is God's. 1 Cor. 3:21-23
poem:
Let Christ assure me he is mine,
I nothing want beside;
My soul shall at the fountain live,
When all the streams are dried.

title: All Blessings in Christ
devotional: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ Jesus. Eph. 1:3
poem:
Oh the rich depths of love divine!
Of bliss a boundless store!
Dear Savior, let me call thee mine,
I cannot wish for more.

title: Pardon Through Christ
devotional: In whom we have redemption through his blood, even the forgiveness of sin. Col. 1:14
poem:
O Lamb of God, thy precious blood
Shall never lose its power,
Till all the ransom'd church of God
Is saved, to sin no more.

title: Justification Through Christ
devotional: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus. Rom. 3:24
poem:
No righteousness but his we own,
No ransom but his blood alone:While on the Father's name we call,
Our faith pleads Christ as all in all.

title: Reconciliation Through Christ
devotional: For if, when we were enemies, we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we shall be saved by his life. Rom. 5:10
poem:
Let us love, and sing, and wonder;
Let us praise the Savior's name:He has hush'd the law's loud thunder,
He has quench'd Mount Sinai's flame:He has wash'd us with his blood,
He has brought us nigh to God.

title: Adoption Through Christ
devotional: As many as received him, to them gave he the power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name. John 1:12
poem:
Let others boast their ancient line,
In long succession great;
In the proud list, let heroes shine
And monarchs swell their state:Descended from the King of kings,
Each saint a nobler title sings.

title: Rest in Christ
devotional: Come unto me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. Matt. 11:28
poem:
Jesus, with thy word complying,
Firm our faith and hope shall be;
On thy faithfulness relying,
We will seek our rest in thee.

title: Safety in Christ
devotional: I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand. John 10:28
poem:
"Unnumber'd years of bliss
I to my sheep will give;
And while my throne unshaken stands
Shall all my chosen live."

title: Strength Through Christ
devotional: I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me. Phil. 4:13
poem:
I can do all things, and can bear
All sufferings, if my Lord be near;
Sweet pleasures mingle with the pains,
While his left hand my head sustains.

title: Spiritual Freedom Through Christ
devotional: If the Son shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed. John 8:36
poem:
Sweet is the freedom Christ bestows,
With which he makes his people free,
A liberty no mortal knows
Till they his great salvation see.

title: Consolation Through Christ
devotional: Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace. 2 Thess. 2:16
poem:
In every trouble, sharp and strong,
My soul to Jesus flies;
My anchor-hold is firm on him,
When swelling billows rise.

title: Peace with God Through Christ
devotional: Being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ. Rom. 5:1
poem:
No fiery vengeance now,
Nor buring wrath comes down;
If justice call for sinners' blood,
The Saviour shows his own.

title: Access to God Through Christ
devotional: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him. Eph. 3:12
poem:
Come boldy to the throne of grace,
Where Jesus kindly pleads;
Ours cannot be a desperate case
While Jesus intercedes.

title: Victory Through Christ
devotional: Thanks be to God, which giveth us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. 1 Cor. 15:57
poem:
Thus strong in the Redeemer's strength,
Sin, death, and hell we tranple down,
Fight the good fight, and win at length,
Through mercy, an eternal crown.

title: Indwelling of the Spirit
devotional: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you? 1 Cor. 3:16

title: Intercession of the Spirit
devotional: The Spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not what we should pray for as we ought: but the Spirit itself maketh intercession for us with groanings which cannot be uttered. Rom. 8:26
poem:
Let pure devotion's fervours rise,
Let every holy feeling glow;
Oh, let the rapture of the skies
Kindle in our cold hearts below.
Come, vivifying Spirit, come,
And make our hearts thy constant home.

title: Sanctification by the Spirit
devotional: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus. 1 Pet. 1:2
poem:
Can aught beneath a power divine
The stubborn will subdue?'Tis thine, eternal Spirit, thine,
To form our hearts anew,'Tis thine the passions to recall,
And upwards bid them rise;
And make the scales of error fall
From reason's darkened eyes.

title: The Fruits of the Spirit
devotional: The fruit of the Spirit is love, joy peace, long-suffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, meekness, temperance: against such there is no law. Gal. 5:22, 23
poem:
'Tis God himself the ground prepares,
His Spirit sows the land;
And every pleasant fruit it bears,
Is nurtur'd by his hand.

title: Inheritance Among the Sanctified
devotional: Brethren, I commend you to God, and to the word of his grace, which is able to build you up, and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified. Acts 20:32
poem:
From earth we shall quickly remove,
And mount to our native abode;
The house of our Father above,
The palace of angels and God.

title: Increase of Grace
devotional: The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon. They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing. Ps. 92:12,14
poem:
Lord, one thing we want,
More holiness grant;
For more of thy mind and thy image we pant:While onward we move
To Canaan above,
Come, fill us with holiness, fill us with love.

title: Persevering Grace
devotional: The righteous shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger. Job 17:9
poem:
The righteous, bless'd with light divine,
Shall prosper on their way;
Brighter and brighter still shall shine,
To glory's perfect day.

title: Confidence in Prayer
devotional:
This is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing 
according to his will, he heareth us. 1 John 5:14
poem:
He who for man their Surety stood,
And poured on earth his precious blood,
Pursues in heaven his mighty plan,
The Saviour and the friend of man.

title: Preservation in Trouble
devotional:
In the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret 
of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me upon a rock. Ps. 27:5
poem:
When I can trust my all with God,
In trial's fearful hour—
Bow, all resign'd, beneath his rod,
And bless his sparing power;
A joy springs up amid distress,
A fountain in the wilderness.

title: All Things Work Together for Good
devotional:
We know that all things work together for good to them that love God, 
to them who are the called according to his purpose. Rom. 8:28

title: Peace of Mind
devotional:
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because 
he trusteth in thee. Isa. 26:3
poem:
Saviour, on earth I covet not
That every woe should cease;
Only, if trouble be my lot,
In thee let me have peace.

title: Peace in Death
devotional:
Mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of that man 
is peace. Ps. 37:37
poem:
How bless'd the righteous when he dies,
When sinks a weary soul to rest!
How mildly beam the closing eyes!
How gently heaves the expiring breast!
Life's labour done, as sinks the clay,
Light from its load the spirit flies;
While heaven and earth combine to say,"How bless'd the righteous when he dies!"

title: Good Works to Be Done
devotional:
These things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have 
believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. Titus 3:8
poem:
Whate'er is noble, pure, refined,
Just, generous, amiable, and kind,
That may my constant thoughts pursue,
That may I love and practise too.

title: Good Works to Be Done to the Glory of God
devotional:
Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to 
the glory of God. 1 Cor. 10:31
poem:
Through Jesus Christ the Just,
My faint desires receive;
And let me in thy goodness trust,
And to thy glory live.

title: Good Works to Be Done After the Example of Christ
devotional:
He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even 
as he walked. 1 John 2:6
poem:
To do his heavenly Father's will
Was his employment and delight;
Humility and holy zeal
Shone through his life divinely bright.

title: Good Works to Be Done Through the Grace of Christ
devotional: Now the God of peace make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is well pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Heb. 13:20, 21
poem:
Then shall we do, with pure delight,
Whate'er is pleasing in thy sight,
As vessels of thy richest grace;
And, having thy whole counsel done,
To thee and thy co-equal Son
Ascribe the everlasting praise.

title: Good Works to Be Done in the Name of Christ
devotional: Whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him. Col. 3:17
poem:
Whate'er I say or do,
Thy glory be my aim;
My offerings all be offered through
His ever blessed name.

title: Improvement of Time
devotional: Knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed. Rom. 13:11
poem:
The time is short, but who can tell
How short his time below may be?
To-day on earth his soul may dwell,
To-morrow in eternity.

title: Improvement of Privileges
devotional:
That on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good heart, 
having heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience. Luke 8:15
poem:
Father of mercies, we have need
Of thy preparing grace;
Let the same hand that gives the seed
Provide a fruitful place.

title: Improvement of Opportunities
devotional: Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest. Eccles. 9:10
poem:
Whate'er our hands shall find to do,
To-day may we with zeal pursue;
Seize fleeting moments as they fly,
And live as we would wish to die.

title: Spiritual Diligence
devotional:
This one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind, and 
reaching forth unto those things which are before, I press toward the mark for the prize 
of the high calling of God in Christ Jesus. Phil. 3:13, 14
poem:
A scrip on my back, and a staff in my hand,
I march on in haste through an enemy's land:The road may be rough, but it cannot be long,
So I'll smooth it with hope, and I'll cheer it with song.

title: Entire Consecration
devotional: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin: but yield yourselves unto God, as those that are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God. Rom. 6:13
poem:
Yield to the Lord, with simple heart,
All that thou hast, and all thou art:Renounce all strength, but strength divine,
And peace shall be for ever thine.

title: Open Profession of Christ
devotional:
Whosoever shall confess me before men, him will I confess also before 
my Father which is in heaven. Matt. 10:32
poem:
Should I to gain the world's applause,
Or to escape its harmless frown,
Refuse to countenance thy cause,
And make thy people's lot my own,
What shame would fill me in that day,
When thou thy glory shalt display!

title: Evil Appearances to Be Avoided
devotional: Abstain from all appearance of evil. 1 Thess. 5:22
poem:
Our Saviour by a heavenly birth
Calls us to holiness on earth,
Bids us our former follies hate,
And from the wicked separate.
We must have holy hearts and hands,
And feet that go where he commands;
A holy will to keep his ways,
And holy lips to speak his praise.

title: Diligence in Keeping the Heart
devotional:
Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of 
life. Prov. 4:23
poem:
Thy business be to keep thy heart,
Each passion to control;
Nobly ambitious well to rule
The empire of thy soul.

title: Search the Scriptures
devotional:
Search the Scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: 
and they are they which testify of me. John 5:39

title: Secret Prayer
devotional:
Thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast 
shut thy door, pray to thy Father wich is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret 
shall reward thee openly. Matt. 6:6
poem:
Far from the paths of men, to Thee
I solemnly retire;
See Thou, who dost in secret see,
And grant my heart's desire.

title: Thanksgiving
devotional:
In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ 
Jesus concerning you. 1 Thess. 5:18
poem:
Praise to God, immortal praise,
For the love that crowns our days;
Bounteous Source of every joy,
Let thy praise our tongues employ.

title: Meditation
devotional:
His delight is in the law of the Lord; and in his law doth he meditate 
day and night. Psalm 1:2
poem:
I love in solitude to shed
The penitential tear;
And all his promises to plead,
When none but God is near.
I love to think on mercies past,
And future good implore;
And all my cares and sorrows cast
On him whom I adore.

title: Self-Examination
devotional:
Examine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own selves. 
2 Cor. 13:5
poem:
At evening to myself I say,
My soul, where hast thou glean'd to-day,
Thy labours how bestow'd?
What hast thou rightly said or done?
What grace attain'd or knowledge won,
In following after God?

title: In Prosperity to Be Humble
devotional: For I say, through the grace given unto me, to every man that is among you, not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think. Rom. 12:3
poem:
Lord, if thou thy grace impart,
Poor in spirit, meek in heart,
I shall, as my Saviour, be
Rooted in humility:Pleas'd with all the Lord provides,
Wean'd from all the world besides.

title: In Adversity to Trust God
devotional:
Who is among you that feareth the Lord, that obeyeth the voice of his 
servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him trust in the name of the Lord, 
and stay upon his God. Isa. 1:10
poem:
If Providence our comforts shroud,
And dark distresses lower,
Hope paints its rainbow on the cloud,
And grace shines through the shower.

title: Self-Government
devotional:
He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth 
his spirit than he that taketh a city. Prov. 16:32
poem:
Happy the man, whose cautious steps
Still keep the golden mean;
Whose life, by Scriputre rules well form'd,
Declares a conscience clean.

title: Self-Denial
devotional:
All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all 
things are lawful for me, but all things edify not. 1 Cor. 10:23
poem:
Lord, ever let me freely yield
What most I prize to thee,
Who never hast a good withheld,
Or wilt withhold from me.
Thy favour all my journey through,
Thou art engaged to grant;
What else I want, or think I do,'Tis better still to want.

title: Contentment
devotional:
Be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never 
leave thee, nor forsake thee. Heb. 13:5
poem:
Since he has said "I'll ne'er depart,"I'll bind his promise to my heart,
Rejoicing in his care:This shall support while here I live,
And, when in glory I arrive,
Will praise him for it there.

title: Patience
devotional:
Ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye 
might receive the promise. Heb. 10:36
poem:
I would submit to all thy will,
For thou art good and wise;
Let every anxious thought be still,
Nor one faint murmur rise.
Thy love can cheer the darksome gloom,
And bid me wait serene,
Till hopes and joys immortal bloom
And brighten all the scene.

title: Meekness
devotional:
Walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called, with all lowliness 
and meekness, with long suffering, forbearing one another in love. Eph. 4:2
poem:
Meekness, humility, and love,
Did through thy conduct shine;
Oh may my whole deportment prove
A copy, Lord, of thine.

title: Temperance
devotional:
Take heed to yourselves, lest at any time your hearts be overcharged 
with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and cares of this life, and so that day come upon you 
unawares. Luke 21:34
poem:
The world employs its various snares,
Of hopes and pleasures, pains and cares,
And chain'd to earth I lie:When shall my fetter'd powers be free,
And leave these seats of vanity,
And upward learn to fly?

title: Gravity and Sincerity
devotional: In all things showing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine showing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity. Titus 2:7
poem:
Pure may I be, averse to sin,
Just, holy, merciful, and true;
And let thine image form'd within,
Shine out in all I speak or do.

title: Watchfulness
devotional: Blessed are those servants, whom the Lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them. Luke 12:37
poem:
Arm me with jealous care,
As in thy sight to live:And oh, thy servant, Lord, prepare,
A strict account to give.
Help me to watch and pray,
And on thyself rely;
Assured if I my trust betray,
I shall for ever die.

title: Diligence in Worldly Calling
devotional:
Study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your 
own hands, as we commanded you. 1 Thess. 4:11
poem:
Midst hourly cares, may love present
Its incense to thy throne;
And while the world our hands employs,
Our hearts be thine alone.

title: Eminent Holiness the Desire of the Believer
devotional:
Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but 
I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Jesus 
Christ. Phil. 3:12
poem:
Oh for a closer walk with God,
A calm and heavenly frame,
A light to shine upon the road
That leads me to the Lamb!

title: To Show Forth the Praises of God
devotional:
Ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a 
peculiar people; that ye should show forth the praises of him who hath called you out 
of darkness into his marvellous light. 1 Pet. 2:9
poem:
Not by your words alone,
But by your actions show,
How much from him you have received,
How much to him you owe.

title: To Depart from All Iniquity
devotional: Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity. 2 Tim. 2:19
poem:
Faith must obey her Father's will,
As well as trust his grace;
A pardoning God is jealous still
For his own holiness.

title: Stedfastness in the Faith
devotional:
Stand fast in the liberty wherewith Christ hath made us free, and be 
not entangled again with the yoke of bondage. Gal. 5:1
poem:
From Egypt lately freed
By the Redeemer's grace,
A rough and thorny path we tread
In hopes to see his face.
The flesh dislikes the way,
But faith approves it well;
This only leads to endless day,
All others lead to hell.

title: Zeal in Defence of the Gospel
devotional: I exhort you that ye should earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints.Jude 3
poem:
In conquests of thy might,
May I loyally delight;
In thy ever-spreading reign,
Triumph as my greatest gain:Make me conscious by this sign,
Gracious Saviour, I am thine.

title: Zeal for Good Works
devotional: Let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works. Heb. 10:24
poem:
Awake, my soul, awake, my love,
And serve my Saviour here below,
In works which all the saints above
And holy angels cannot do.

title: Zeal for Divine Worship
devotional:
Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of 
some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching. 
Heb. 10:25
poem:
Oh let me always find a place,
Within the temples of thy grace;
Till God command my last remove,
To dwell in temples made above!

title: Concern for the Peace of the Church
devotional:
Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the 
God of love and peace shall be with you. 2 Cor. 13:11
poem:
Make us of one heart and mind,
Courteous, pitiful, and kind;
Lowly, meek in thought and word,
Altogether like our Lord.

title: Concern for the Prosperity of the Church
devotional: Peace be within thy walls and prosperity within thy palaces. Psa. 122:7
poem:
For our dear brethren's sake,
Zion, we wish thee peace;
Prosper, oh! prosper long,
And may thy sons increase:We seek thy good, we love the road
Which leads us to God's bless'd abode.

title: Mutual Love
devotional: >Walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling savour. Eph. 5:2
poem:
Among the saints on earth
Let mutual love be found;
Heirs of the same inheritance,
With mutual blessings crown'd.

title: Mutual Subjection
devotional: All of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble. 1 Pet. 5:5

title: Mutual Honour
devotional: Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves. Phil. 2:3
poem:
Oh let each esteem his brother
Better than himself to be;
And let each prefer another,
Full of love, from envy free:Happy are we,
When in this we all agree.

title: Mutual Forbearance
devotional: Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye. Col. 3:13
poem:
May we each with each agree,
Through thy uniting grace:Our gift shall thine accepted be,
Our life be love and praise.

title: Mutual Candour
devotional: Judge not, that ye be not judged. Why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother's eye, but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Matt. 7:1, 3
poem:
Make us by thy transforming grace,
Great Saviour, daily more like thee:Thy fair example may we trace,
To teach us what we ought to be.

title: Mutual Forgiveness
devotional: Be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you. Eph. 4:32
poem:
"Is Christ divided?" What can part
The members from the Head?
Oh how should those be one in heart
For whom our Saviour bled?

title: Mutual Admonition
devotional: I myself am persuaded of you, mu brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another. Rom. 15:14
poem:
Bonds of everlasting love
Draw our souls in union,
To our Father's house above,
To the saints' communion.
Thither may our hopes ascend,
There may all our labours end.

title: Mutual Consolation and Edification
devotional: Comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do. 1 Thess. 5:11
poem:
While we journey, let us
Help each other on the road;
Foes on every side beset us,
Snares through all the way are strew'd:It behoves us,
Each to bear a brother's load.

title: Mutual Intercession
devotional: Pray one for another.—The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much. James 5:16
poem:
Before our Father's throne
We pour our ardent prayers;
Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one—
Our comforts and our cares.

title: Unity of Sentiment
devotional: Whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing. Phil. 3:16
poem:
Bound to one Lord, by common vow
In one great enterprize;
One faith, one hope, one centre now,
Our common home, the skies.

title: Unity of Judgment
devotional: I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no divisions among you; but that ye be perfectly joined together in the same mind and in the same judgment. 1 Cor. 1:10
poem:
Lord, subdue our selfish will,
Each to each our tempers suit,
By thy modulating skill,
Heart to heart, as lute to lute.

title: United Prayer
devotional: Where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them. Matt. 18:20
poem:
Where two or three with sweet accord,
Obedient to their sovreign Lord,
Meet to recount his acts of grace,
And offer solemn prayer and praise;
There, saith the Savior, will I be
Amid the little company.

title: United Praise
devotional: Teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and humns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord. Col. 3:16
poem:
Teach us, though in a world of sin,
Heaven's bless'd employment to begin,
To sing our great Redeemer's praise;
And love his name, and learn his ways.

title: Pious Conversation
devotional: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth, but that which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minister grace unto the hearers. Eph. 4:29
poem:
Wheresoever two or three
Meet, a Christian company,
Grant us, Lord, to meet with thee:Gracious Saviour, hear!
When with friends beloved we stray,
Talking down the closing day,
Saviour, meet us in the way:Gracious Saviour, hear!

title: Compassion for the Weak
devotional: We that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves. Rom. 15:1
poem:
When weaker Christians we despise,
We do the great Redeemer wrong;
For God, the gracious and the wise,
Receives the feeble with the strong.

title: Compassion for the Afflicted
devotional: Remember them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity, as being yourselves also in the body. Heb. 13:3
poem:
With pity let my breast o'erflow,
When I behold another's woe;
And hear a sympathizing part,
Whene'er I meet a wounded heart.

title: Compassion for the Poor
devotional: As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, especially unto them who are of the household of faith. Gal. 6:10
poem:
Awake, my charity, and feed
The hungry soul, and clothe the poor;
In heaven are found no sons of need,
There all these duties are no more.

title: Compassion to Those Who Have Erred
devotional: Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a foult, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted. Gal. 6:1
poem:
Lord, we would strive, and hope, and wait,
The offending still to reinstate;
And when a broken heart we view,
Our Christian friendship quick renew.

title: Freedom from Slander
devotional: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge. James 4:11
poem:
Love is a pure and heavenly flame,
And much regards a brother's name;
It hopeth all things, and believes,
Nor easily a charge receives.

title: Esteem for the Ministry
devotional: We beseech you to know them which labour among you, and are over you in the Lord, and admonish you; and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. 1 Thess. 5:12, 13
poem:
How beauteous are their feet,
Who stand on Zion's hill;
Who bring salvation on their tongues,
And words of peace reveal!

title: Prayer for the Ministry
devotional: Praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit;—and for me, that utterance may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to make known the mystery of the gospel. Eph. 6:18, 19
poem:
With heavenly power, O Lord, defend
Those whom we now to thee commend;
Thy faithful messengers secure,
And make them to the end endure.

title: Unbelief Should Be Guarded Against
devotional: Take heed, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God. Heb. 3:12
poem:
How oft, deceived by self and pride,
Has my weak heart been turn'd aside;
And, Jonah-like, has fled from thee,
Till thou hast look'd again on me!

title: Caution Against Apostasy
devotional: Looking diligently lest any man fail of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and thereby many be defiled. Heb. 12:15
poem:
What bright exchange, what treasure shall be given,
For the lost birthright of a hope in heaven?
If lost the gem which empires could not buy,
What yet remains?—a dark eternity.

title: Believers Are the Salt of the Earth
devotional: Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men. Matt. 5:13
poem:
Strive thou with studious care to find
Some good thy hands may do;
Some way to serve and bless mankind,
Console the heart, relieve the mind,
And open comforts new.

title: Believers Are the Light of the World
devotional: Ye are the light of the world. Matt. 5:14
poem:
Walk in the light—and thine shall be
A path, though stormy, bright;
For God in love hsall dwell with thee—
And God himself is light!

title: The Universal Rule of Equity
devotional: All things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets. Matt. 7:12
poem:
Blessed Redeemer, how divine,
How righteous is this rule of thine,
To do to all men just the same
As we expect or wish from them.
How bless'd would every nation prove
Thus ruled by equity and love!
All would be friends without a foe,
And form a paradise below.

title: To Glorify God by Holy Conduct
devotional: I beseech you as strangers and pilgrims, abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul; having your conversation honest among the Gentiles. 1 Pet. 2:11
poem:
Help thy servant to maintain
A profession free from stain;
That my sole reproach may be,
Following Christ, and fearing thee.

title: Abounding in the Work of the Lord
devotional: My beloved brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as ye know that your labour is not in vain in the Lord. 1 Cor. 15:58
poem:
Sow in the morn thy seed,
At eve hold not thy hand,
To doubt and fear give thou no heed,
Broad-cast it round thy land.

title: Decision of Character
devotional: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon. Matt. 6:24
poem:
Not a broken, brief obedience
Does the Lord of heaven demand;
He requires our whole allegiance,
Words and deeds, and heart and hand:God will hold divided sway
With no diety of clay.

title: Holy Example
devotional: Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven. Matt. 5:16
poem:
So let our lips and lives express
The holy gospel we profess;
So let our works and virtues shine
To prove the doctrine all divine.

title: Live in Peace with All Men
devotional: If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men. Rom. 12:18
poem:
His purpose is that we should bear
His image now on earth,
And by our peaceful lives declare
Our new and heavenly birth.

title: Love to Our Neighbor
devotional: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well. James 2:8
poem:
Love lays its own advantage by
To seek its neighbour's good;
So God's own Son came down to die,
And bought our lives with blood.
Love is the grace that keeps its power
In all the realms above;
There faith and hope are known no more
But saints for ever love.

title: Seek the Edification of Our Neighbour
devotional: Let every one of us please his neighbour for his good to edification. Rom. 15:2
poem:
May I from every act abstain,
That hurts or gives another pain:Still may I feel my heart inclin'd
To be the friend of all mankind.

title: Love to All Men
devotional: The Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another, and toward all men, even as we do toward you. 1 Thess. 3:12
poem:
May love, that shining grace,
O'er all my powers preside;
Direct my thoughts, suggest my words,
And every action guide.

title: To Seek the Salvation of Others
devotional: He which converteth the sinner from the error of his way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a multitude of sins. James 5:20

title: Give Due Honour to All
devotional: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour. Rom. 13:7

title: Consistency
devotional: That ye may be blameless and harmless, the sons of God, without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine as lights in the world. Phil. 2:15
poem:
That wisdom, Lord, on us bestow
From every evil to depart,
To stop the mouth of every foe,
While upright both in life and heart,
The proof of godly fear we give,
And show them how the Christians live.

title: Circumspection
devotional: See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise. Redeeming the time, because the days are evil. Eph. 5:15, 16
poem:
Let every flying hour confess
I gain the gospel fresh renown;
And when my life and labours cease,
May I possess the promised crown.

title: Discretion
devotional: A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guide his affairs with discretion. Psalm 112:5
poem:
Believers love what God commands,
And in his ways delight;
Their gracious words, and holy hands
Show that their faith is right.
Their converse is with God above,
Their labours bless mankind;
Their works of mercy, peace, and love,
Through Christ acceptance find.

title: Moderation
devotional: Let your moderation be known unto all men. The Lord is at hand. Phil. 4:5
poem:
We'll look on all the toys below
With such disdain as angels do;
And wait the call that bids us rise
To mansions promised in the skies.

title: Forbearance
devotional: Dearly beloved, avenge not yourselves, but rather give place unto wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine; I will repay, saith the Lord. Rom. 12:19
poem:
May I feel beneath my wrongs
Vengeance to the Lord belongs;
Nor a worse requital dare,
Than meek revenge of prayer:Much forgiven, may I learn,
Love for hatred to return.

title: Industry
devotional: Let a man labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that ye may have to give to him that needeth. Eph. 4:28

title: Integrity
devotional: That ye may walk honestly toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack of nothing. 1 Thess. 4:12
poem:
Come, let us search our ways, and try
Have they been just and right;
Is the great rule of equity
Our practice and delight?
In all we sell, in all we buy,
Is justice our design?
Do we remember God is nigh,
And fear the wrath Divine?

title: Fidelity
devotional: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much. Luke 16:10
poem:
Thy gifts are only then enjoy'd
When used as talents lent;
Those talents only well employ'd
When in his service spent.

title: Truth and Sincerity
devotional: Wherefore, putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another. Eph. 4:25
poem:
Let those who bear the Christian name
Their holy vows fulfil;
The saints, the followers of the Lamb,
Are men of honour still.

title: Gentleness and Meekness
devotional: Speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, showing all meekness to all men. Tit. 3:2
poem:
Bless'd are the men of peaceful life,
Who quench the coals of growing strife,
They shall be called the heirs of bliss,
The sons of God, the sons of peace.

title: Benevolence
devotional: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this, To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep himself unspotted from teh world. James 1:27
poem:
The poor are always with us here:'Tis our great Father's plan,
That mutual wants and mutual care
Should bind us man to man.

title: Overcome Evil with Good
devotional: If thine enemy hunger feed him: if he thirst, give him drink: fo in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head. Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good. Rom. 12:20, 21
poem:
Thus artists melt the sullen ore of lead,
With heaping coals of fire upon its head;
In the kind warmth the metal learns to glow,
And loose from dross the silver runs below.

title: Perseverance in Doing Good
devotional: Let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap if we faint not. Gal. 6:9
poem:
Meek pilgrim Zionward, if thou
Hast put thy hand unto the plough,
Oh look not back, nor droop dismay'd,
At thought of victory delay'd:Doubt not that thou, in season due,
Shall own his gracious promise true;
And thou shalt share their glorious lot,
Whom doing well hath wearied not.

title: Submission to Authority
devotional: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work. Titus 3:1

title: Universal Holiness the Believer's Aim
devotional: Whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are honest, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report; if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things. Phil. 4:8
poem:
Father of eternal grace,
Glorify thyself in me;
Meekly beaming in my face,
May the world thine image see.

title: Believer's Humble Confession
devotional: So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do. Luke 17:10
poem:
My present triumphs, and my past,
Are thine, and must be to the last;
And if the crown of life I wear,
Thy hand alone must place it there.

title: The Great Motive to All Duty
devotional: Ye are not your own; for ye are bought with a price: therefore glorify God in your body, and in your spirit, which are God's. 1 Cor. 6:19, 20
poem:
Oh! grant us, Lord, to feel and own
The power of love divine;
The blood which doth for sin atone,
The grace which makes us thine.

title: Joy in God
devotional: Let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee. Psalm 5:11
poem:
When with his smiles my soul he deigns to bless,
Nor cares nor crosses can my peace destroy,
Possessing all things if I him possess,
Enjoying all things if I him enjoy.

title: Joy in Christ
devotional: We are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh. Phil. 3:3
poem:
The opening heavens around me shine
With beams of sacred bliss,
While Jesus shows his heart is mine,
And whispers, I am his.

title: Joy in the Holy Ghost
devotional: The kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost. Rom. 14:17
poem:
Holy Ghost, dispel our sadness,
Pierce the cloud of sinful night;
Come, thou source of joy and gladness,
Breathe thy life, and shed thy light.

title: The Gospel a Source of Joy
devotional: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance. Psalm 89:15
poem:
Bless'd are the souls that hear and know
The gospel's joyful sound;
Peace shall attend the path they go,
And light their steps surround.

title: The Atonement a Source of Joy
devotional: We joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the atonement. Rom. 5:11
poem:
There is a fountain fill'd with blood,
Drawn from Immanuel's veins,
And sinners plunged beneath that flood
Lose all their guilty strains.
They dying thief rejoic'd to see
That fountain in his day;
And here may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away.

title: The Scriptures a Source of Joy
devotional: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O Lord God of hosts. Jer. 15:16
poem:
Oh may these heavenly pages be
My ever dear delight;
And still new beauties may I see,
And still increasing light.

title: The Sabbath a Source of Joy
devotional: This is the day which the Lord hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it. Psalm 118:24
poem:
Oft as this peaceful day shall come,
Lord, raise my thoughts from earthly things,
And bear them to my heavenly home,
On faith and hope's celestial wings
Till the last gleam of life decay,
In one eternal sabbath day.

title: Faith a Source of Joy
devotional: Whom having not seen, ye love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy unspeakable and full of glory. 1 Pet. 1:8
poem:
A bleeding Saviour, seen by faith,
A sense of pardoning love,
A hope that triumphs over death,
Gives joys like those above.

title: Pardon a Source of Joy
devotional: Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. Blessed is the man unto whom the Lord imputeth not iniquity, and in whose spirit there is no guile. Psalm 32:1, 2

title: Hope of Glory a Source of Joy
devotional: By whom [Jesus Christ] we have access by faith into this grace whereinwe stand, and rejoice in hope of the glory of God. Rom. 5:2
poem:
By faith to Pisgah's top I fly,
And there delighted stand,
To view beneath a cloudless sky,
The spacious promised land.
The Lord of all the vast domain
Has promised it to me;
The length and breadth of all the plain,
As far as faith can see.

title: Godly Fear a Source of Joy
devotional: Blessed is every one that feareth the Lord; that walketh in his ways. For thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happy shalt thou be, and it shall be well with thee. Psalm 128:1, 2
poem:
Happy, beyond description, he
Who fears the Lord his God;
Who hears his threats with holy awe,
And trembles at his rod.

title: Obedience a Source of Joy
devotional: I will delight myself in thy commandments which I have loved. Psalm 119:47
poem:
Then shall my heart have inward joy,
And keep my face from shame,
When all thy statutes I obey,
And honour all thy name.

title: Communion with God a Source of Joy
devotional: There be many that say, Who will show us any good? Lord, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us. Thou has put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased. Psalm 4:6, 7
poem:
Lord, what is life? if spent with thee,
In humble praise and prayer,
How long or short my life may be
I feel no anxious care:Though life depart, my joys shall last,
When life and all its joys are past.

title: Communion of Saints a Source of Joy
devotional: My goodness extendeth not to thee; but to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight. Psalm 16:2, 3

title: Prayer a Source of Joy
devotional: Even them will I bring to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer. Isaiah 56:7
poem:
Prayer makes the darken'd cloud withdraw,
Prayer climbs the ladder Jacob saw;
Gives exercise to faith and love,
Brings every blessing from above.

title: Salvation a Source of Joy
devotional: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners. Psalm 20:5

title: Early Piety a Source of Joy
devotional: O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days. Psalm 90:14
poem:
Grace is a plant, where'er it grows,
Of pure and heavenly root;
But fairest in the young it shows,
And yields the sweetest fruit.

title: A Good Conscience a Source of Joy
devotional: Our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world. 2 Cor. 1:12
poem:
O happy soul, that lives on high,
While men lie grovelling here;
Whose hopes are fix'd above the sky,
And faith forbids his fear.
His conscience cleans'd from all his sins,
Love, peace, and joy combine
To form a life whose holy springs
Are hidden and divine.

title: Benevolence a Source of Joy
devotional: Remember the words of the Lord Jesus, how he said, It is more blessed to give than to receive. Acts 20:35
poem:
Bless'd is the man whose heart expands
At melting pity's call,
And the rich blessings of whose hands
Like heavenly manna fall.

title: Tribulation a Source of Joy
devotional: We glory in tribulation: knowing that tribulation worketh patience; and patience, experience; and experience, hope. Rom. 5:3, 4
poem:
Then let us wait the' appointed day,
Nor call this world our home;
To pilgrims in a foreign land,
Afflictions needs must come.
Who rule the world, o'errules their end,
They destined are for good;
And bear the saints to realms of rest,
Though mighty as a flood.

title: Temporal Blessings Sources of Joy
devotional: Ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the Lord your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed. Joel 2:26
poem:
Thy bounty gilds the path of life
With every cheering ray,
And oft restrains the rising tear,
Or wipes that tear away.

title: The Divine Blessing a Source of Joy
devotional: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it. Prov. 10:22
poem:
Better than life itself thy love,
Dearer than all beside to me;
For whom have I in heaven above,
Or what on earth, compared to thee?

title: The Divine Protection a Source of Joy
devotional: Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice. Psalm 63:7
poem:
Since thou hast been my help,
To thee my spirit flies;
And on thy watchful providence
My cheerful hope relies.

title: Divine Acceptance a Source of Joy
devotional: Go thy way, eat thy bread with joy, and drink thy wine with a merry heart; for God now accepteth thy work. Eccles. 9:7
poem:
Whilst I see thy love to me,
Every object teems with joy;
Here, oh may I walk with thee,
Then into thy presence die!
Let me but thyself possess,
Total sum, of happiness;
Real bliss I then shall prove—
Heaven below, and heaven above.

title: Joy Following Sorrow
devotional: Weeping may endure for a night; but joy cometh in the morning. Psalm 30:5
poem:
When comforts are declining,
He grants the soul again,
A season of clear shining,
To cheer it after rain.

title: Joy the Duty of the Believer
devotional: Be glad in the Lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for joy, all ye that are upright in heart. Psalm 32:11
poem:
Let those refuse to sing
Who never knew our God;
But children of the heavenly King
Should speak their joys abroad.

title: Joy to be Sought Through Christ
devotional: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full. John 16:24

title: Believer's Joy Is Satisfying
devotional: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple. Psalm 65:4
poem:
These are the joys which satisfy,
And sanctify the mind;
Which make the spirit mount on high,
And leave the world behind.

title: Believer's Joy Is Abiding
devotional: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full. John 15:11
poem:
Art thou not mine, my living Lord?
And can my hope, my comfort die,
Fix'd on thine everlasting word—
The word that built the earth and sky.

title: Believer Has Joy in Death
devotional: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word: for mine eyes have seen thy salvation. Luke 2:29, 30
poem:
When we have number'd all our years,
And stand, at length, on Jordan's brink;
Though the flesh fail with mortal fears,
Oh! let not then the spirit sink:But strong in faith, and hope, and love,
Plunge through the stream to rise above.

title: Heaven the Consummation of Joy
devotional: Well done, thou good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy Lord. Matt. 25:21
poem:
Soldier of Christ, well done!
Praise be thy new employ;
And while eternal ages run,
Rest in thy Saviour's joy.

title: Believer Forewarned of Sorrow
devotional: These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world. John 16:33
poem:
The path of sorrow, and that path alone,
Leads to the land where sorrow is unknown.
No traveller e'er reached that bless'd abode,
Who found not thorns and briars in his road.

title: Sources of Sorrow -- Loss of Divine Favour
devotional: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free Spirit. Psalm 51:12
poem:
Ah! why, by passing clouds oppress'd,
Should vexing thoughts distract thy breast?
Turn, turn to Him, in every pain,
Whom never suppliant sought in vain.

title: Temptations Permitted by God
devotional: The Lord said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thine hand. Job 1:12
poem:
Still thine integrity hold fast,
The tempter's counsel spurn,
Hope against hope, and God at last,
Will for thy help return.

title: God Does Not Tempt to Sin
devotional: Let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempted of God: for God cannot be tempted with evil, neither tempteth he any man: but every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust, and enticed. James 1:13, 14
poem:
My crimes, though great, do not surpass
The power and glory of thy grace;
Oh! wash my soul from every sin,
And make my guilty conscience clean.

title: Temptations -- From Satan
devotional: Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his devices. 2 Cor. 2:11
poem:
Fear not Satan's strong temptations
Though they tease thee day by day,
And thy evil inclinations
Overwhelm thee with dismay!
Thou shalt conquer,
Through the Lamb's redeeming blood.

title: Temptations -- From a Depraved Nature
devotional: I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present with me. Rom. 7:21
poem:
Oh! who can free my troubled mind
From sin's oppressive load?
O wretched man! how shall I find
Acceptance with my God.

title: Temptations -- From the Love of Riches
devotional: They that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition. 1 Tim. 6:9
poem:
Oh lay not up upon this earth
Your hopes, your joys, your treasure,
Here sorrow clouds the pilgrim's path,
And blights each opening pleasure.
All, all below must fade and die,
The dearest hopes we cherish,
Scenes touch'd with brightest radiancy,
Are all decreed to perish.

title: Temptations -- From the Fear of Man
devotional: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the Lord shall be safe. Prov. 29:25
poem:
The taunts and frowns of men of earth,
What are they all to me!
Oh they are things of little worth,
Weigh'd with one smile from Thee,
Who bore a sorrow deeper far,
Than all these stingless trifles are.

title: Temptation to Neglect Good Works
devotional: Ye did run well; who did hinder you, that ye should not obey the truth? Gal. 5:7
poem:
Better that we had never known
The way to heaven through saving grace,
Than basely in our lives disown,
And slight and mock thee to thy face.

title: Temptation to Legal Dependance
devotional: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect in the flesh. Gal. 3:3
poem:
Go, you that rest upon the law,
And toil and seek salvation there;
Look to the flame that Moses saw,
And shrink, and tremble, and despair.
But I'll retire beneath thy cross—
Saviour, at thy dear feet I'll lie;
And the keen sword that justice draws,
Flaming and red, shall pass me by.

title: Temptation to Formality in Religion
devotional: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God. Rev. 3:2

title: Temptation to Slothfulness in Religion
devotional: Nevertheless I have somewhat against thee, because thou has left thy first love. Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works. Rev. 2:4, 5
poem:
I need the influence of thy grace
To speed me in the way,
Lest I should loiter in my pace,
Or turn my feet astray.

title: Temptation to Self-Indulgence
devotional: I keep under my body, and bring it into subjection: lest that by any means, when I have preached to others, I myself should be a castaway. 1 Cor. 9:27
poem:
When thy statutes I forsake,
When my graces dimly shine,
When my covenant I break,
Jesus, then remember thine:Check my wanderings
By a look of love divine.

title: Temptation to Trifle with Sin
devotional: Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound? God forbid. How shall we, that are dead to sin, live any longer therein? Rom. 6:1
poem:
Shall we go on to sin,
Because thy grace abounds?
Or crucify the Lord again,
And open all his wounds?
We will be slaves no more,
Since Christ has made us free;
Has nail'd our tyrants to his cross,
And bought our liberty.

title: Temptation to Spiritual Pride
devotional: For who maketh thee to differ from another? and what hast thou that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receive it, why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not received it? 1 Cor. 4:7
poem:
Oft have I turn'd my eyes within,
And brought to mind some latent sin
But pride, the vice I most detest,
Still lurks securely in my breast.

title: Temptation to Envy the Wicked
devotional: As for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped. For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked. Psalm 78:2,3

title: Temptation to Mistrust Providence
devotional: If God so clothe the grass of the field, which today is, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith? Matt. 6:30

title: Temptation to Despair
devotional: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me. I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God. Psalm 69:2, 3
poem:
Prostrate before thy mercy-seat,
I cannot if I would despair;
None ever perish'd at thy feet,
And I would lie for ever there.

title: Temptation Humbles the Believer
devotional: Lest I should be exalted above measure through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalted above measure. 2 Cor. 12:7
poem:
What though a thorn my bosom bears,
And varied are the wants and cares,
That mark my chequer'd way!
My God hath said, in whom I live,"My grace is thine, and strength I give
According to thy day."

title: Temptation to Be Resisted
devotional: For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world, against spiritual wickedness in high places. Eph. 6:12
poem:
From strength to strength go on,
Wrestle, and fight, and pray;
Tread all the powers of darkness down,
And win the well-fought day.

title: Temptation to Be Avoided
devotional: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men. Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away. Prov. 4:14, 15
poem:
A wicked world and wicked heart
With Satan are combined:Each acts a too successful part,
In harassing my mind.

title: Temptation Avoided by Watchfulness and Prayer
devotional: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation. Matt. 26:41
poem:
Go to dark Gethsemane,
Ye that feel the tempter's power,
Your Redeemer's conflict see,
Watch with him one bitter hour;
Turn not from his griefs away,
Learn of Jesus Christ to pray.

title: Temptation Overcome by Faith
devotional: Above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked. Eph. 6:16
poem:
Let faith exert its conquering power,
Say in thy tempted, trembling hour,"My God, my Father, save thy son!"'Tis heard—
and all thy fears are done.

title: Believer Armed Against Temptation
devotional: Take unto you the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and having done all, to stand. Eph 6:13
poem:
The Christian warrior—
see him stand
In the whole armour of his God;
The Spirit's sword is in his hand,
His feet are with the gospel shod.

title: Preservation from Temptation
devotional: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation. Rev. 3:10
poem:
Thus preserved from Satan's wiles,
Safe from dangers, free from fears,
May I live upon thy smiles,
Till the promised hour appears:When the sons of God shall prove
All their Father's boundless love.

title: Preservation in Temptation
devotional: Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him. James 1:12
poem:
When aught shall tempt my soul to stray
From heavenly wisdom's narrow way,
To shun the precept's holy light,
Or quit my hold on Jesus' might,
May He who felt temptation's power
Still guard me in that dangerous hour.

title: Deliverance from Temptation
devotional: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations. 2 Pet. 2:9
poem:
What though fierce and strong temptations
Press around thee on the way,
And thy sinful inclinations
Often cause thee great dismay!
Look to Jesus,
Thou through him shalt gain the day.

title: Christ the Strength of the Tempted
devotional: My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. 2 Cor. 12:9
poem:
Why should I fear the darkest hour,
Or tremble at the tempter's power!
Jesus vouchsafes to be my tower.
Though hot the fight, why quit the field?
Why must I either fear or yield,
Since Jesus is my mighty shield?

title: Christ's Sympathy with the Tempted
devotional: In that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted. Heb. 2:18
poem:
Touch'd with a sympathy within,
He knows our feeble frame;
He knows what sore temptations mean,
For he has felt the same.

title: Christ's Intercession for the Tempted
devotional: The Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan hath desire to have you, that he may sift you as wheat: but I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not. Luke 22:31, 32

title: The Lord's Prayer for the Tempted
devotional: Lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil. Matt. 6:13
poem:
Protect us in the dangerous hour,
And from the wily tempter's power,
Lord, set our spirits free;
And if temptation should assail,
May mighty grace o'er all prevail,
And lead our hearts to thee.

title: Freedom from Temptation in Heaven
devotional: To him that overcometh, will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne. Rev. 3:21
poem:
Though temptations now attend thee,
And thou tread'st the thorny road,
His right hand shall still defend thee,
Soon he'll bring thee home to God:Full deliverance
Thou shalt have in heaven above.

title: Duty of Retrospection
devotional: Thou shalt remember all the way which the Lord thy God led thee these forty years in the wilderness, to humble thee, and to prove thee, to know what was in thine heart, whether thou wouldst keep his commandments. Deut. 8:2
poem:
Thus far the Lord has led me on,
And made his truth and mercy known;
And while I tread this desert land,
New mercies shall new songs demand.

title: Of the Divine Help
