devotional: Then Samuel took a stone, and set it between Mizpeh and Shen, and called the name of it Ebenezer, saying, Hitherto hath the Lord helped us. 1 Sam. 7:12
poem:
Here I raise my Ebenezer,
Hither, by thy help, I'm come:And I hope, by thy good pleasure,
Safely to arrive at home.

title: Of the Divine Guidance
devotional: Who am I, O Lord God? and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto? and this was yet a small thing in thy sight, O Lord God. 2 Sam. 7:18, 19

title: Of the Divine Faithfulness
devotional: Thou hast dealt well with thy servant, O Lord, according unto thy word. Psalm 119:65
poem:
Since first the maze of life I trod,
Hast thou not hedged about my way,
My worldly vain designs withstood,
And robb'd my passions of their prey?
Thrice happy loss, which makes me see
My happiness alone in thee!

title: Of the Divine Forbearance
devotional: It is of the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not, They are new every mornning: great is thy faithfulness. Lam. 3:22, 23
poem:
Lift up to God the voice of praise,
Whose goodness, passing thought,
Loads every minute as it flies
With benefits unsought.

title: Of the Divine Mercy
devotional: He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities. Psalm 103:10
poem:
He hath with a piteous eye
Look'd upon our misery:Let us, then, with gladsome mind,
Praise the Lord, for he is kind:For his mercies shall endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

title: Of the Divine Counsel and Instruction
devotional: I will bless the Lord, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons. Psalm 16:7
poem:
Sure the Lord thus far has brought me,
By his watchful tender care;
Sure, 'tis he himself has taught me
How to seek his face by prayer:After so much mercy past,
Will he give me up at last?

title: Of Divine Promises Fulfilled
devotional: Ye know in all your hearts and in all your souls, that not one thing hath failed of all the good things which the Lord your God spake concerning you; all are come to pass unto you, and not one thing hath failed therof. Josh. 23:14
poem:
In all my ways thy hand I own,
Thy ruling providence I see;
Assist me still my course to run,
And still direct my paths to thee.

title: Of Unnumbered Blessings
devotional: Many, O Lord my God, are thy wonderful works which thou hast done, and thy thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: if I would declare and speak of them, they are more than can be numbered. Psalm 40:5
poem:
For mercies countless as the sand,
Which daily I receive
From Jesus, my Redeemer's hand,
My soul, what canst thou give?

title: Of Early Pious Instruction
devotional: Continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and has been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them. 2 Tim. 3:14
poem:
Lord, hast thou made me know thy ways?
Conduct me in thy fear;
And grant me such supplies of grace
That I may persevere.

title: Of His Natural State
devotional: You that were sometime alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now hath he reconciled. Col. 1:21
poem:
Plunged in a gulf of dark despair,
We wretched sinners lay,
Without one cheerful beam of hope,
Or spark of glimmering day.

title: Of the Sins of His Life
devotional: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin. Job 13:23
poem:
My past transgressions pain me;
Lord, cleanse my heart within;
And evermore restrain me
From all presumptuous sin.
So let my whole behaviour,
Thoughts, words, and actions be,
O God, my strength and Saviour,
Acceptable to thee.

title: Of Past Unprofitableness
devotional: For when ye were the servants of sin, ye were free from righteousness. What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed? Rom. 6:20, 21
poem:
Lord, I confess my numerous faults,
How great my guilt has been;
Foolish and vain were all my thoughts,
And all my life was sin.

title: Of the Season of Conversion
devotional: Giving thanks unto the Father, which hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light: who hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated us into the kingdom of his dear Son. Col. 1:12, 13
poem:
Since the dear hour that brought me to thy foot,
And cut up all my follies by the root,
I never trusted in an arm but thine,
Nor hoped but in thy righteousness Divine:—
Cast at thy glorious feet, mine only plea
Is what it was, dependance upon Thee.

title: Of Spiritual Deliverance
devotional: Great is thy mercy toward me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell. Psalm 86:13
poem:
He pardon'ed my transgressions,
Bade all my sorrows cease;
And, in his rich compassions,
Restored my soul to peace.

title: Of Spiritual Enjoyments
devotional: I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste. He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love. Sol. Song 2:3, 4
poem:
Kindly he brought me to the place
Where stands the banquet of his grace;
He saw me faint, and o'er my head
The banner of his love he spread.

title: Of Support in Affliction
devotional: Unless thy law had been my delight, I should then have perished in mine affliction. Psalm 119:92
poem:
God of my life, how good, how wise
Thy judgements to my soul have been!
They were but blessings in disguise,
The painful remedies of sin.
How different now thy ways appear,
Most merciful, when most severe!

title: Of Answers to Prayer
devotional: I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications. Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, therefore will I call upon him as long as I live. Psalm 116:1, 2
poem:
Did ever trouble yet befall,
And he refuse to hear thy call?
And has he not his promise pass'd,
That thou shalt overcome at last?

title: Of Deliverance from Adversity
devotional: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities. Psalm 31:7

title: Of Deliverance from Danger
devotional: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not. O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life. Lam. 3:57, 58

title: Of Deliverance from Death
devotional: O Lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit. Psalm 30:3
poem:
Thy mercy chased the shades of death,
And snatch'd me from the grave;
Oh may thy praise employ that breath
Which mercy deigns to save!

title: Of the Vanity of Human Life
devotional: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been. Gen. 47:9
poem:
This life's a dream, an empty show,
But the bright world to which we go
Hath joys substantial and sincere:When shall I wake, and find me there?

title: Of Departed Friends
devotional: I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as others which have no hope. For if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so them also which sleep in Jesus will God bring with him. 1 Thess. 4:13, 14
poem:
Though loved and lost, not ours the pang of those
Whose earth-born grief no heavenly balsam knows:We would not call their spirits from their home
Where sin assails them not, and sorrow cannot come.

title: Aged Believer's Retrospect
devotional: O God, thou has taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works. Now also when I am old and greyheaded, O God, forsake me not. Psalm 71:17, 18
poem:
Still hath my life new wonders seen
Repeated every year:Behold, my days which yet remain
I trust them to thy care.

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Gratitude
devotional: What shall I render unto the Lord for all his benefits toward me? I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the Lord. Psalm 116:12, 13
poem:
When all thy mercies, O my God,
My rising soul surveys,
Transported with the view I'm lost
In wonder, love and praise.

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Self-Examination
devotional: I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times. I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own heart: and my spirit made diligent search. Psalm 77:5, 6
poem:
Help me, O Lord, to try my heart,
To search with strictest care,
And all my thoughts, and words, and ways,
With Scripture to compare.

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Self-Abasement
devotional: And Jacob said, I am not worthy of the least of all thy mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast shewed unto thy servant. Gen. 32:10
poem:
Unworthy, Lord, of all
Thy mercies though we be,
Yet for the greatest we may call,
The greatest are most free.

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Repentance
devotional: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more: that which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more. Job 34:31, 32
poem:
In thought, in will, in word and deed,
What evils have I done,
Against the God of grace and love,
His Spirit and his Son?

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Amendment of Life
devotional: I thought on my ways, and turned my feet unto thy testimonies. I made haste, and delayed not to keep thy commandments. Psalm 119:59, 60
poem:
Thou art my portion, O my God;
Soon as I know thy way,
My heart makes haste to obey thy word,
And suffers no delay.

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Confidence in God
devotional: Return unto thy rest, O my soul; for the Lord hath dealt bountifully with thee. For thou hast delivered my soul from death, mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling. Psalm 116:7, 8
poem:
For this, when future sorrows rise,
To him will I direct my cries;
For this, through all my future days,
Adore his name, and sing his praise.

title: Retrospection Should Lead to Devotedness to God
devotional: Only fear the Lord, and serve him in truth with all your heart: for consider how great things he hath done for you. 1 Sam. 12:24
poem:
My God, my King, thy various praise
Shall fill the remnant of my days;
Thy grace employ my humble tongue
Till death and glory raise the song.
May every hour successive bear
Some thankful tribute to thine ear;
And by thy grace accepted be,
As works of love perform'd for Thee.

title: Believer's Confidence in God
devotional: My times are in thy hand: make thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies' sake. Psalm 31:15, 16

title: Of Future Support
devotional: Trust in the Lord, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed. Psalm 37:3, 4

title: Of Deliverance from Trouble
devotional: Thou, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles, shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths of the earth. Psalm 71:20
poem:
From every piercing sorrow
That heaves our breast to-day,
Or threatens us to-morrow,
Hope turns our eyes away;
On wings of faith ascending,
We see the land of light,
And feel our sorrows ending
In infinite delight.

title: Of Being Kept by Christ
devotional: I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed unto him against that day. 2 Tim. 1:12
poem:
Beneath his smiles my heart has liv'd,
And part of heaven possess'd;
I thank him for the grace receiv'd,
And trust him for the rest.

title: Of the Completion of the Work of Grace
devotional: Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ. Phil. 1:6
poem:
He will complete the work begun,
He will his own defend;
Will give me strength my course to run,
And love me to the end.

title: Of the End of His Warfare
devotional: The time of my departure is at hand. I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith. 2 Tim. 4:6, 7
poem:
Oh most delightful hour by man
Experienced here below,
The hour that terminates his span
Of conflict and of woe!

title: Of Victory Over Satan
devotional: The God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. Rom. 16:20
poem:
Now let my soul arise,
And tread the tempter down;
My Captain leads me forth
To conquest and a crown:A feeble saint shall win the day,
Though death and hell obstruct the way.

title: Of Victory Over Sin
devotional: O wretched man that I am! who shall deliver me from the body of this death? I thank God, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Rom. 7:24, 25
poem:
Now to the God of victory
Immortal thanks be paid,
Who makes us conquerors while we die,
Through Christ our living Head.

title: Of Victory Over the Grave
devotional: God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall receive me. Psalm 49:15
poem:
There, till the archangel's trumpet sound
Ages of silence I shall lie;
Then from my earthly cell rebound,
Glorious in immortality.

title: Of the Certainty of Death
devotional: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return. Job 16:22
poem:
Welcome, sweet hour of full discharge,
That sets my longing soul at large;
Unbinds my chains, breaks up my cell,
And gives me with my God to dwell.

title: Of Support in the Hour of Death
devotional: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me. Psalm 23:4
poem:
When the vale of death appears,(Faint and cold this mortal clay,)Kind Forerunner, soothe my fears,
Light me through the darksome way:Break the shadows,
Usher in eternal day.

title: Of the End of the World
devotional: The day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up. 2 Pet. 3:10
poem:
Lo! it comes—
that day of wonder!
Louder chorals shake the skies:Hades' gates are burst asunder;
See the new-clothed myriads rise!

title: Of a Joyful Resurrection
devotional: I know that my Redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth: and though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God. Job 19:25, 26
poem:
Though worms may waste this with'ring clay,
When flesh and spirit sever;
My soul shall see eternal day,
And dwell with God for ever.

title: Of the Coming of Christ to Judgment
devotional: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Rev. 1:7
poem:
Great God! what do I see and hear!
The end of things created:The Judge of mankind doth appear
In clouds of glory seated;
The trumpet sounds, the graves restore
The dead which they contain'd before:Prepare, my soul, to meet him.

title: Of Meeting the Judge
devotional: We must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in his body, according to that he hath done, whether it be good or bad. 2 Cor. 5:10
poem:
Oh! on that day, that wrathful day,
When man to judgment wakes from clay,
Lord, be the trembling sinner's stay,
Though heaven and earth shall pass away.

title: Of Entire Acquittal
devotional: Who shall lay any thing to the charge of God's elect? It is God that justifieth. Who is he that condemneth? It is Christ that died; yea rather, that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of God, who also maketh intercession for us. Rom. 8:33, 34
poem:
Fear not the drum's earth-rending sound,
Dread not the day of doom;
For He that is to be thy Judge,
Thy Saviour is become.

title: Of Participation in the Judgement
devotional: Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? 1 Cor. 6:2
poem:
See the Judge, our nature wearing,
Cloth'd in majesty divine;
Ye who long for his appearing
Then shall say, "This God is mine:"Gracious Saviour,
Own us in that day of thine!

title: Of Being Presented Faultless
devotional: Unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy. Jude 24
poem:
What transport then shall fill my heart,
When thou my worthless name wilt own;
When I shall see thee as thou art,
And know as I myself am known!

title: Of an Incorruptible Body
devotional: So when this corruptible shall have put on incorruption, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written, Death is swallowed up in victory. 1 Cor. 15:54
poem:
Where then thy triumph, Grave? and where thy sting,
O sullen Death? what terror dost thou bring?
We burst thine iron band, and soar on high—
Glory to Christ the Lord, who brings us victory!

title: Of a Glorious Body
devotional: Who shall change our vile body, that it may be fashioned like unto his glorious body, according to the working whereby he is able even to subdue all things unto himself. Phil. 3:21
poem:
My flesh shall slumber, in the ground
Till the last trumpet's joyful sound;
Then burst the chains, with sweet surprise,
And in my Saviour's image rise.

title: Of Being with Christ
devotional: To me to live is Christ, and to die is gain, For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ, which is far better. Phil. 1:21, 23
poem:
'Tis best, 'tis infinitely best,
To go where tempests never come;
Where saints and angels, ever blest,
Dwell, and enjoy their heavenly home.

title: Of Being Ever with Christ
devotional: Then we which are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord. 1 Thess. 4:17
poem:
Oh, who can tell what joy shall beam
On all the ransom'd race,
When they shall join the hallow'd strains
And see the Saviour's face!

title: Of Reigning with Christ
devotional: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him: if we suffer, we shall also reign with him. 2 Tim. 2:11, 12
poem:
Ever upward may we move,
Wafted on the wings of love:Looking when our Lord shall come,
Longing, gasping after home!
There may we with thee remain,
Partners of thine endless reign.

title: Of Being Like Christ
devotional: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see him as he is. 1 John 3:2
poem:
Him eye to eye we there shall see,
Our face like his shall shine:Oh, what a glorious company,
When saints and angels join!

title: Of an Heavenly Habitation
devotional: We know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens. 2 Cor. 5:1
poem:
There is a home for weary souls,
By sin and sorrow driven;
When toss'd on life's tempestuous shoals,
Where storms arise, and ocean rolls,'Tis found above—
in heaven.

title: Of Perfection of Knowledge in Heaven
devotional: Now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face: now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known. 1 Cor 13:12
poem:
As through a glass I dimly see
The wonders of thy love;
How little do I know of thee,
Or of the joys above!'Tis but in part I know thy will—
I bless thee for the sight—
When will thy love the rest reveal
In glory's clearer light?

title: Of a Crown of Righteousness
devotional: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, shall give me at that day. 2 Tim. 4:8
poem:
God has laid up in heaven for me
A crown which cannot fade;
The righteous Judge, in that great day,
Shall place it on my head.

title: Of Reunion with Glorified Spirits
devotional: What is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Are not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming? 1 Thess. 2:19
poem:
We soon shall join the throng,
Their pleasures we shall share,
And sing the everlasting song
With all the ransom'd there:Hallelujah!
We are on our way to God.

title: Believer's Anticipations a Call to Holiness
devotional: Wherefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and blameless. 2 Pet. 3:14
poem:
Yet with these prospects full in sight
I'll wait thy signal for my flight;
For while thy service I pursue,
I find a heaven in all I do.

title: Eternal Life the Gift of God
devotional: Now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlasting life. For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. Rom. 6:22, 23
poem:
From thee, my God, my joys shall rise,
And run eternal rounds,
Beyond the limits of the skies,
And all created bounds.

title: Eternal Life the Purchase of Christ
devotional: Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us. Heb. 9:12
poem:
Pardon and peace to dying men,
And endless life are given:By the rich blood that Jesus shed
Our souls are brought to heaven.

title: Eternal Life Secured by the Spirit
devotional: The Holy Spirit of promise is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory. Eph. 1:13, 14
poem:
Dost thou not dwell in all the saints,
And seal the heirs of heaven?
When wilt thou banish my complaints,
And show my sins forgiven.

title: Heaven the Desire of the Saints
devotional: Whilst we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord, we are confident, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord. 2 Cor. 5:6, 8
poem:
In that bright city I would dwell,
With that bless'd church the Saviour praise,
And, safe, redeem'd from death and hell,
Sit at his feet through endless days.

title: Heaven a Rest
devotional: There remaineth a rest to the people of God. Heb. 4:9
poem:
Oh where shall rest be found,
Rest for the weary soul?'Twere vain the ocean-depths to sound,
Or pierce to either pole.
Beyond this vale of tears,
There is a life above,
Unmeasured by the flight of years—
And all that life is love.

title: Heaven Compared to a Marriage Supper
devotional: Write, Blessed are they which are called unto the marriage supper of the Lamb. Rev. 19:9
poem:
"Worthy the Lamb!" aloud they cry,"That brought us here to God:"In ceaseless hymns of praise they shout
The merits of his blood.

title: Heaven an Inheritance
devotional: He is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of etermal inheritance. Heb. 9:15
poem:
There is my house and portion fair,
My treasure and my heart are there,
And my abiding hom;
For me my elder brethren stay,
And angels beckon me away,
And Jesus bids me come.

title: Heaven a Kingdom
devotional: I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my Father hath appointed unto me; that ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom. Luke 22:29, 30
poem:
O God! O Good beyond compare!
If all thy meaner works are fair,
How glorious must that kingdom be,
Where thy redeem'd shall dwell with thee!

title: Heaven Is Prepared Mansions
devotional: In my Father's house are many mansions: if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you. John 14:2
poem:
High in yonder realms of light,
Far above these lower skies,
Fair and exquisitely bright,
Heaven's unfading mansions rise.
Glad within these bless'd abodes,
Dwell the' enraptur'd saints above,
Where no anxious care corrodes,
Happy in Immanuel's love.

title: Heaven Compared to Paradise
devotional: Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To-day shalt thou be with me in paradise. Luke 23:43
poem:
There is a land of pure delight,
Where saints immortal reign;
Infinite day excludes the night,
And pleasures banish pain.
There everlasting spring abides,
And never-withering flowers:Death, like a narrow sea, divides
This heavenly land from ours.

title: Heaven a State of Holiness
devotional: There shall in no wise enter into it any thing that defileth, neither whatsoever worketh abomination, or maketh a lie: but they which are written in the Lamb's book of life. Rev. 21:27
poem:
The soul, from sin for ever free,
Shall mourn its power no more,
But clothed in spotless purity,
Redeeming love adore.

title: Heaven a State of Happiness
devotional: Thou wilt show me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore. Psalm 16:11
poem:
Love, in an ever-deepening tide,
O'er all the plains above
Spreads, like a sea immensely wide—
For God himself is Love.

title: Heaven a State of Service
devotional: They serve him day and night in his temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell among them. Rev. 7:15
poem:
And swift to do his high behest
Each spirit wings its flight;
And virtue glows on every breast,
A gem of purest light.

title: No Sorrow in Heaven
devotional: God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes; and there shall be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall there be any more pain: for the former things are passed away. Rev. 21:4
poem:
Joy and gladness banish sighs,
Perfect love dispels their fears,
And for ever from their eyes,
God shall wipe away all tears.

title: No Curse in Heaven
devotional: There shall be no more curse: but the throne of God and the Lamb shall be in it. Rev. 22:3
poem:
When we shall Christ in glory meet,
Our utmost joys shall be complete:When landed on that heavenly shore,
Death and the curse shall be no more.

title: No Night in Heaven
devotional: There shall be no night there; and they need no candle, neither light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light: and they shall reign for ever and ever. Rev. 22:5
poem:
Nor needed is the shining moon,
Nor e'en the sun's bright ray;
For glory, from the sacred throne,
Spreads everlasting day.

title: No Death in Heaven
devotional: They which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world, and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage: neither can they die any more: for they are equal unto the angels. Luke 20:35, 36
poem:
There pain and sickness never come,
And grief no more complains;
Health triumphs in immortal bloom,
And endless pleasure reigns.

title: Praises of Heaven
devotional: They sung a new song, saying, Thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation. Rev. 5:9
poem:
Hark! hark! the voice of ceaseless praise
Around Jehovah's throne,
Songs of celestial joy they raise,
To mortal lips unknown.

title: Society of Heaven
devotional: These are they which came out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb: therefore are they before the throne of God. Rev. 7:14, 15
poem:
Clad in raiment pure and white,
Victor-palms in every hand,
Through their great Redeemer's might,
More than conquerors they stand.

title: Saints Shall Be with God
devotional: He will dwell with them, and they shall be his people, and God himself shall be with them, and be their God. Rev. 21:3
poem:
Oh glorious hour! oh bless'd abode!
I shall be near and like my God;
And flesh and sin no more control
The sacred pleasures of the soul.

title: Saints Shall Be with Christ
devotional: Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am; that they may behold my glory. John 17:24
poem:
Oh then shall the veil be remov'd,
And round me thy brightness be pour'd:I shall meet Him whom absent I lov'd,
I shall see Him whom unseen I ador'd!

title: Saints Shall Inherit All Things
devotional: He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son. Rev. 21:7

title: Saints Shall Be Perfect
devotional: Ye are come unto the general assembly and church of the first-born, which are written in heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect. Heb. 12:22, 23
poem:
A life in heaven! oh what is this?
The sum of all that faith believed;
Fullness of joy, and perfect bliss,
Unseen—
unfathom'd—
unconceiv'd.

title: Saints Shall Be Glorious in Appearance
devotional: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Matt. 13:43
poem:
The Lamb is their light and their sun,
And, lo, by reflection they shine;
With Jesus ineffably on,
And bright in effulgence divine.

title: Saints Shall Be Honored as Victors
devotional: I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands. Rev. 7:9
poem:
Now the conquerors bring their palms
To the Lamb amidst the throne,
And proclaim in joyful psalms,
Victory through his cross alone.

title: Saints Shall Be Kings and Priests Unto God
devotional: Thou hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth. Rev. 5:10
poem:
Thou hast redeem'd our souls with blood,
Hast set the prisoners free,
Hast made us kings and priests to God,
And we shall reign with thee.

title: Joys of Heaven Are Sure
devotional: Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men! Psalm 31:19
poem:
This is the hope that shall sustain me
Till life's pilgrimage be past;
Fears may vex, and troubles pain me,
I shall reach my home at last.

title: Joys of Heaven Are Abundant
devotional: The Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of water. Rev. 7:17
poem:
The Lamb that fills the middle throne
Shall shed around his milder beams,
There shall they feast on his rich love,
And drink full joys from heavenly streams.

title: Joys of Heaven Are Satisfying
devotional: I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness. Psalm 17:15
poem:
Oh! when awaken'd by thy care,
Thy face I view, thy image bear,
How shall my breast with transport glow!
What full delight my heart o'erflow!

title: Joys of Heaven Are Eternal
devotional: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out. Rev. 3:12
poem:
The everlasting doors
Shall soon the saints receive,
Above, with angel powers,
In glorious joy to live:Far from a world of grief and sin,
With God eternally shut in.

title: Believers to Wait for Heaven
devotional: Blessed is he that waiteth, and cometh to the thousand three hundred and five and thirty days. But go thou thy way till the end be: for thou shalt rest, and stand in thy lot at the end of the days. Dan. 12:12, 13
poem:
Jerusalem, my happy home,
My soul still pants for thee;
When shall my labours have an end
In joy, and peace, and thee.
